bibl.author: William E. Babcock
bibl.title: William E. Babcock to Walt Whitman, 18 October 1864
bibl.orgName: Berg Collection at the New York Public Library

dateline.name:
Headquarters 51st N.YV
Near Poplar Grove Church Va

body.p: Your Letter came to hand this morning and I hasten to answer the Same.
Your Brothers Effects will be Sent forward to Your Mothers address, Soon as we can get a permit from the Provost Marshall General, which I have this day Sent a request for.

I was much pleased to hear from him and the rest of the Officers that were taken prisoners with him. And I know they were neither wounded
nor killed, as we had no chance of hearing from them until your Letter Arrived.
Every thing is quiet with Us and no news. So I will bring this to a close, by requesting you to write Soon.

postscript.p:
P.S. Letters from You will at all Times be received & Answered with pleasure
WE Babcock
